topic: Deep dive: _string standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _string standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: _string Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a comprehensive overview of the updated features and functions of the _string standard library module in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Enhancements and new functions in Python 3.12+
version_notes: Updated: capwords(), digits(), hexdigits(), printable(), punctuation(), repeat(), and split() functions now work correctly with bytes.
Deprecated: atoi(), atof(), and atoul() functions have been removed.
caveats: Always ensure you are using the latest version of Python (3.12+) to take advantage of these enhancements
Be cautious when using byte-related functions with string data, as they may behave unexpectedly
